application.name: vims2isis
application.brief: Converts Vims images to Isis 3 format
application.description: This program takes the BIL formatted vims cubes and translates them into Isis 3 standard BSQ format. It also separates them into two cubes, one containing the data from the Infrared camera, and one containing the data from the visual camera.

history.change: Fixed Start Time and Stop Time output
Added Spacecraft Clock Start and Stop Time keywords to label output
Fixed bug with exposure duration, was written out to labels as string instead of numeric.
Fixed bug with exposure duration in Vis cube labels
Added appTests and enabled importing of uncalibrated data
Checks if input file is rdr.
Added support for more raw data
If sideplane data is present it is now stored in the output cubes for calibration. More keywords are now propagated.
Saturation values are now set when present and if IR or VIS was turned off then files will not be imported for those channels.
Added the ability to translate Vims label for both IR and VIS cubes
Corrected indexing for SAMPLING_MODE_ID and GAIN_MODE_ID values.
Changed DATA_SET_ID check to be INSTRUMENT_ID check instead, DATA_SET_ID was too specific and wasn't allowing imports of appropriate data.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: This is the input image to be processed. It is 352 bands deep, the first 96 of which are visual data, and the final 256 of which are IR data.

parameter.name: VIS
parameter.description: This is the destination for the cube containing the visual light data. It consists of the first 96 bands of the original cube, reorganized into BSQ format

parameter.name: IR
parameter.description: This is the destination for the cube containing the IR data. It consists of the final 256 bands of the original cube, reorganized into BSQ format
